Posted By: Darandragon (7/12/2009 12:17:12 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: as a turn one way to fill the graveyard, this has combo potential with threshold and delve and reanimator strategies ala Careful Study. Playing this late game when you are holding only lands and/or less impactful cards lets you also gamble on trading up. Seems like grease in a deck designed with graveyard shenanigans in mind for sure.
posts.html:

Posted By: greenmonk (8/5/2009 10:21:46 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I believe the flavor is something along the lines of instilling everyone with a feverish lust for knowledge that is likely to hurt them in the rush (like cramming for a test). Anyway, it's inspired me to finally make a draw-pain deck. This card is a crucial part of any Megrim or Underworld dreams combo to me.
  
   
The "burning" mentioned in the flavor text is not meant literally.

Posted By: demigodofrevenge (7/17/2009 12:56:44 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: very solid card for red/black decks. Especially against control players, you can really mess up their counters, combos, etc. with the random discard. In my opinion, this will hurt the average red player a lot less than blue or white. As has been said, great with [megrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=megrim), also helps by throwing more into the graveyard for late game uses of [haunting echoes](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=haunting echoes), for the truly devious R/B player =P. 4/5
posts.html:
very solid card for red/black decks. Especially against control players, you can really mess up their counters, combos, etc. with the random discard. In my opinion, this will hurt the average red player a lot less than blue or white. As has been said, great with megrim, also helps by throwing more into the graveyard for late game uses of haunting echoes, for the truly devious R/B player =P. 4/5

Posted By: Grimn777 (7/29/2009 2:01:58 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'm surprised this is a common. It's way too dangerous for that.
  
   
Yes... yes... for those of us who realize the gravity of megrim, it is very refreshing.
  
   
This reminds me of how frequently people say "[winds of change](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=winds of change)is a dumb card;" but then when you play it they end up with hands that don't play out very well- if at all. This will certainly have that affect, even without graveyard, dicard, draw, mill etc. for synergy.
posts.html:
I'm surprised this is a common. It's way too dangerous for that.

Yes... yes... for those of us who realize the gravity of megrim, it is very refreshing.

This reminds me of how frequently people say "winds of changeis a dumb card;" but then when you play it they end up with hands that don't play out very well- if at all. This will certainly have that affect, even without graveyard, dicard, draw, mill etc. for synergy.

posts.post_content: Its definitely a great card for those [Megrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Megrim)-[Kederekt Parasite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kederekt Parasite)-[Howling Mine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Howling Mine) type decks. Not entirely sure on the flavor here though: if he's so obsessed with burning stuff then why did he own a bunch of scrolls and a lab in the first place?
posts.html:
Its definitely a great card for those Megrim-Kederekt Parasite-Howling Mine type decks. Not entirely sure on the flavor here though: if he's so obsessed with burning stuff then why did he own a bunch of scrolls and a lab in the first place?

Posted By: DragonLord132 (8/31/2009 1:56:48 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Not a huge fan. While obviously a Johnny card, at common its a pretty poor card and while you'll mess up both player's hands, you're just as likely to mess up your own as your foes. The only real advantage is that it can act as a sort of pseudo-mulligan which can make your opponent's hand worse.  
  
While it can be combined with other cards, its really not worth it due to the card disadvantage.
posts.html:
Not a huge fan. While obviously a Johnny card, at common its a pretty poor card and while you'll mess up both player's hands, you're just as likely to mess up your own as your foes. The only real advantage is that it can act as a sort of pseudo-mulligan which can make your opponent's hand worse.

While it can be combined with other cards, its really not worth it due to the card disadvantage.
